record.description: The Ring Nebula in Lyra [designated Messier 57], a shell of glowing hydrogen and oxygen, surrounds a central star of the 13th magnitude, whose surface temperature is roughly 70,000 degrees Celsius. The ultraviolet radiation of this central star causes the shell's gases to glow. Photograph taken at the Cassegrain focus of the 82-inch McDonald telescope with an exposure of five minutes.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Attached caption is sticking to the photograph.
